Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery vessel, possibly an oenochoe; light convex moulding on lower neck; white slip; interior glazed black with added white bands; exterior, from bottom: part of single triangle as filling ornament on presumed shoulder; on moulding, band of black leaves or rays between brown lines; row of dots; band of alternating lotus buds and flowers.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels regarding the decoration, see Lemos no. 338 from Rizari, which she reasonably takes as an oenochoe neck. The moulding on the neck may indicate that the jug was animal-headed or the like.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0215) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 50 (Other Accession Number)
